intro: Plantago raoulii, commonly known as Raouli’s plantain, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in a spike, which are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
